H0.text: where would a subcutaneous injection be made in the skin. The dermis

H1.text: where would a subcutaneous injection be made in the skin. The hypodermis

H2.text: where would a subcutaneous injection be made in the skin. The epidermis

H3.text: where would a subcutaneous injection be made in the skin. the subcutis

A4.text: A subcutaneous injection is administered as a bolus into the subcutis, the layer of skin directly below the dermis and epidermis, collectively referred to as the cutis.

A5.text: A subcutaneous injection is administered into the fatty tissue of the subcutaneous tissue, located below the dermis and epidermis.
